page.title: 07HARDWICK-ITS GARDENS & PARK
page.content: Attached to{Hardwick Hall,}enclosed within the walled courtyards are fine {gardens, orchards}and a{herb garden. The gardens can be viewed separately and attract many visitors. A{Country Park}surrounds the property and contains a flock of{Whiteface {Woodland sheep}and a herd of{Longhorn {cattle.}The{lake}in the Park provides facilities for{fishing}and{canoeing. There is also a{duck decoy plantation which is being renovated for future use. Planned{nature walks}can be followed and certain pleasant areas have been designated as{picnic areas. It is both interesting and a pleasure to note that the gardens and some parts of the Park were accessible to the{physically disabled.}Also the herb and flower gardens were particularly recommended to the{visually {handicapped.
